title: 104_hr2104
content: The Act titled "Protection of Children From Computer Pornography Act of 1995" prohibits the transmission of indecent material to minors via computer. The Act "Protection of Children From Computer Pornography Act of 1995" prohibits the transmission of indecent material to minors via computer, amending Section 1464 of title 18, United States Code to include the utterance of indecent or profane language by radio communication and transmission of indecent material to minors from remote computer facilities or electronic services. The Act prohibits the transmission of indecent material to minors via computer, including electronic communications services that allow users to transfer digital material between computers. The Act defines electronic bulletin board service as a computer system primarily for providing digital images or online discussion groups. Transmission of indecent material to minors is prohibited via computer services. The Act prohibits the transmission of indecent material to minors through electronic communication services, with penalties including fines and imprisonment for up to 5 years. The Act prohibits the transmission of indecent material to minors through electronic communication services, with penalties including fines and imprisonment for up to 5 years. Any provider who knowingly allows the transmission of such material to a person under 18 may face a fine of up to $10,000, imprisonment for up to 2 years, or both. Civil actions challenging the constitutionality of this provision will be heard by a district court. The Act prohibits the transmission of indecent material to minors through electronic communication services, with penalties including fines and imprisonment for up to 5 years. Civil actions challenging the constitutionality of this provision will be heard by a district court of three judges in accordance with section 2284 of title 28, United States Code. The Attorney General must report to Congress within 2 years on technology allowing parents to block indecent material transmission to minors. Recommendations on using blocking technology as a defense to prosecution under section 1464(b) are included.
